Reviews.Title: “First Trip to Alhambra”
Reviews.Author: Karen R
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Alhambra and found the hotel to be perfect for us. It's a small family owned hotel with the best staff we have ever experienced in all our trips to Mexico. From Mario being there to welcome us, the owners along with both the restaurant staff and the beach waiters, it was all perfect. The rooms are on the small side and can be somewhat noisy at night, but that's to be expected in a town like PDC. We planned our trip back on our flight home and without a doubt, it will include a stay at Alhambra.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Simple and Super Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Alice M
Reviews.Content: Right on the beach. If you are looking for a super duper plush hotel ... this isn't the spot for you. It is clean, very simple (no tv) and the staff is awesome. Bring your own toiletries - but big fluffy beach towels are there for you at the front desk. They also have yoga classes throughout the day for no extra cost. They have buses/tours they can arrange for you at the front desk. Ask about the Temazecal in Tulum. Such a great experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to rest........”
Reviews.Author: Xitlalli13
Reviews.Content: Alhambra hotel is conveniently situated in the heart of 5th Avenue. The place is clean and comfortable and the prices are reasonable. You can find bathrooms on the lobby so you dont have to go upstairs. The staff is very kind. Rooms are big and very clean. The food is excellent so you dont have to search for more. I would definetly return. As a handicap person, the only inconvenience I found is that they dont have rooms on the first floor and they dont have elevator. They have a solarium where you can take as much sun as needed! It is worth for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent playa del carmen hotel on beach”
Reviews.Author: nathanwaks
Reviews.Content: After 2 false starts we finally found a good, reasonably priced option in ever changing PLaya del Carmen. Location is what it's all about here- walk out from the bar and onto the beach, without the noise of some other beach hotels. Hotel is clean rooms are comfortable, only niggle being a low pressure shower. Also no TV a plus or minus.... great fast wifi. also a first in this town.

Reviews.Title: “IT WORKS”
Reviews.Author: Cokingafair
Reviews.Content: i satayed there foo a week n i get an amazing vacation. Rooms are clean and nice. very well located in a nice beach with no rocks and very clean. The food it`s great they have a restaurant ( zabor ) that is not only for the guess of the resort also for walkers and ppl who joins the beach. So you can be sure that you`ll have a great menu and variety. Many kinds of Ceviche and seafood. The staff are friendly and warm to all. Waitters alwas can help and i just get relaxed and happy. I really recomend this small hotel to get relaxed and taned.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Beachfront Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kathy_rodgers
Reviews.Content: Great beachfront location close to 5th Avenue shops and restaurants. Spacious and comfortable room. Breakfast and other meals can be had at tables on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Just gets better and better.”
Reviews.Author: sunnydaze62
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th year at the Alhambra and we had another great week. We stayed in room 12 for 4 years straight. It is a street side with balcony and ocean view. We went ahead and reserved the ocean front room for next year. We love the Alhambra!!!!! I don't know what the folks from Ottowa are talkin about because we have never found a speck of dirt in the four years we have stayed. We were also there in February and the staff was as nice and attentive as ever. The front desk people all speak english to us all the time. The maid can not speak english but we have never had a problem. There was a group of young very loud and rude soccer players that were asked by the hotel staff to quiet down after many complaints from the other hotel guest. I am suspicious that may explain the very bad review they have given. The food and drinks are great. The cheviche is the best in Playa and the breakfast is included. I have never heard anyone complain about the food or drinks, in fact it is one of the reasons we stay there. Our first year in Playa we stated at the Aventura Mexicana and although the hotel is nice the food was bad and it was too far from the beach. We had stumbled upon the Alhambra while walking down the beach and fell in love (Especially with the Margaritas) The Maquito Beach Hotel is next door and is very nice but it is also expensive. If you want to waste alot of MONEY on fancy furniture go there. The food, drinks or location are no better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great breakfast, a little expensive, but nice”
Reviews.Author: TravelfoodiefromHamp
Reviews.Content: We had the nicest room in the hotel. We had the only king size bedroom over looking the water. Our room was next to the yoga studio and we had a balcony which wrapped around the hotel from the beach to the side entrance. It was clean, hat hot fresh water showers, breakfast was included and delicious. The location was in the center of everything. Our hotel helped us book a scuba diving trip, although fun...I would recommend diving closer to Cozumel. The only thing a little annoying was the club next door. We kept the windows open for the breeze and it was a bit loud.... but we could have turned the air conditioner on if we were really bothered. The hotel is a bit expensive for what you get, but it appears Mexico is just as expensive as the US these days. You must try El Fogon restaurant if you are in Playa del Carmen!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelingbasket
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 4 nights at this lovely little hotel from Feb 11-15. Everything about this hotel was exactly what we expected, and then some. Both the front desk and on-site restaurant service was impeccable - thank you!! The hotel's decor is very pretty and the rooms are simple and super-clean! Beds are quite firm as is common in Mexico, but apparently my body likes that since I slept very well! The food at the restaurant was delicious. Anyone who loves seafood MUST have their ceviche - I particularly enjoyed the Caribbean one with mango in it. I'm craving one just writing about it! Beach chairs were readily available, unlike the fight for chairs at the big all-inclusive resorts. Couldn't ask for a better location - on the beach, but a stone's throw away from 5th Ave. I could go on & on....but if you have any questions, feel free to contact me for more....

Reviews.Title: “Great place, yoga”
Reviews.Author: ArtandStaff
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, great view, service, yoga AM classes, art desplays we loved it

Reviews.Title: “A small and wonderful place, will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: ktj214
Reviews.Content: Such a great place to stay! Small and comfortable, all amenities that a person needs. Great staff, and VERY clean and comfortable. Daniel does such a geat job as general manager. The service was spectacular. Jose, Andres, Santiago, Alfonso, Miguel, Edwardo, and the others did a great job!! They work very hard at making your stay at the Alhambra an experience to remember!! Will definitely see our Alhambra Family again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with a wonderful and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: cjerene
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alhambra is a small but wonderful hotel. The rooftop access is amazing for early risers who want to catch a beautiful sunrise front and center! You feel like family and get first class service from all the employees. My family has celebrated Christmas in Playa for 3 years now and this stay is definitely is at the top of the list!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: JustAtraveler_11
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel FACING THE OCEAN!!!! in the middle of everything, great service, clean, outstanding!! and of course wonderful vacations, the food at the restaurant was pretty good. I would recomend this place to my family and friends!!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Malapaduci
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Morrocon style hotel located on the beach in the center of town. Rooms are comfortable with balconies if requested. The view is slightly of the beach but there is no reason not to stay under a beach umbrella all day with the staff to serve you breakfast & lunch. Jose is a great waiter. The hotel and rooms are kept very clean. Substanital towels and small bars of soap were provided daily. Face cloths are provided if asked. Would recommend bringing shower scrunchie & soap. Food is good, especially the chilequiles & fresh squeeze OJ for the breakfast which is included and ceviche. The location is just a block away from the main shopping and eating district on 5th Ave. You can easily walk the whole length of 5th Ave. The staff is very friendly & helpful & can set up excursions. American Express is not accepted for the hotel. Book through the hotel website directly for discounts. Knowing a little Spanish is good. There is no TV, phone, etc. so relax and enjoy. Bring ear plugs if evening music bothers you. The ceiling fans are wonderful. Outside was cool so no need for airconditioner. I will come back in the Spring.

Reviews.Title: “Towels and soap”
Reviews.Author: wlenn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights. It is the perfect location. Close to everything. Tremendous beach. We would not go back there however. Yes, the rooms were clean. They were rather small, especially the bathroom. Our room had a balcony and bordered the street. It was extremely noisy. We found the staff to be not very accommodating. We asked for more towels ( you get two to a room) and they said no. We had two small bars of soap and they never replaced them. We finally complained again about the towels and they relented. The AC was noisy and if you did not have it on it was just too hot in the room. No TV, phone, radio, clock. Perfect for a newlywed. I would have enjoyed a tv just to get caught up on what was going on in the world. I guess you get what you pay for. Next time I will try a different hotel....maybe the the Illusion or the hotel right next to it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location, very clean, excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: jkelly800
Reviews.Content: We have stayed on many all inclusive resorts in Playa Del Carmen, and really they are all very nice. In fact I have also stayed at the Royal Hideaway and the Iberostar Quetzal this year. However, when we are not traveling to the area with a group of friends, we stay only at the Alhambra Hotel. For those who want to experience the town, the people, and the restaurants of Playa Del Carmen the Alhambra is for you. You are directly in the middle of the main Playa Del Carmen beach, just north of the ferry dock to Cozumel, and you are one block from the main street, 5th avenue. The rooms and hotel are spotless, and the staff, management, and beach staff are always excellent. I know this because this past week was about the 7th time we have stayed here. The rooms are simple, no TV, Radio, or phones. Beds can get hard after several days, but most that I have slept on in Playa usually are set on a cement pedestal instead of a box spring and eventually get hard on the back. The beach is perfect, the staff provides great service, and they have the best Margarita on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Alhambra is a wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Edgewoodfarm1
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the best location and best beach area in Playa. Great balconies and views. Great food served to you under the palapa or on your beach chair. Cleanest rooms, peaceful and relaxing atmoshere, yet just steps from all the action . The entire staff was awesome. Absolute Paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Extended Stay in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: LaPlayaDelCarmen
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best vacation ever. Goodbye to all inclusive resorts and hello to Hotel Alhambra. We stumbled upon this nice hotel in search of somewhere to stay in Playa. Very affordable and clean. Nice staff and close to 5th ave for the adventure of little shops, nightlife and food. Right on the beach, and the service at the beach is wonderful. The rooms are simple, no tv, no phone, but FREE WIFI. That was nice to have. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone looking to enjoy a quiet, quaint, place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “horrible beds...”
Reviews.Author: plasticbike
Reviews.Content: You know, I hate to give Alhambra such a mixed review...but I just have to. I would say a 3.5 if I could. The rooms were adequate and accurately represented on the website... they have free water in the rooms and if you book an ocean front room... we stayed in 14... you will be pleased with your patio/view. The problem that I had with Alhambra was the bed. I have no idea what this bed was made out of...It felt like memory foam or something... and I am not picky when it comes to beds, but after the first night I had pretty acute pain in my neck and shoulders... after the second it was worse, and after the third, I couldn't WAIT to go home. the service was pretty good, Daniel was specifically nice, and the rates reasonable considering you are REALLY in a great location for both the beach and for nightlife/shopping on 5th. there is also Yoga in room 13 for a small fee (i think it was $10) which is nice if you do Yoga. It got a little loud at night, but this IS Playa del Carmen after all... so know that this is a party town before you go, and plan to fall asleep around 2am. All-in-all, it was OK, clean and adequate, but I wouldn't return. That said, I haven't yet found a place in Playa that I would absolutely love to return to which is on the beach. La Tortuga will be my next attempt, although I will miss being right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: pocketagua
Reviews.Content: The Alhambra is right in the center of all the fun.Best location in town for enjoying the beach,and 5th avenue.Having said that,the rooms are rather spartan,and if you go to playa to spend a lot of time in your room you will probably be a little disappointed.However the staff is attentive, polite,and very helpful.The service is excellent,the food is good, the ceviche is as good as anything on the Riviera maya and the margaritas are great, the best on the beach. If you use your hotel as a base to enjoy all the amenities playa del carmen has to offer you would be hard pressed to find a better value. this was our third year there and were making reseverations for next year now.

Reviews.Title: “A Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: itsalongwinter
Reviews.Content: We ended up with an extra night after our stay at an all inclusive and chose the Hotel Alhambra based on the overwhelmingly positive reviews here on Tripadvisor. I'm not sure whether the other resoundingly positive reviewers had significantly better rooms than we had or significantly lower expectations but either way we found our room to be a big disappointment. To start, I will say that on the positive side, the room was clean which is a big plus. Also, the air conditioning in our room worked just fine. We were in room B. It was pretty large but as pointed out by other reviewers it was furnished with whatever miscellaneous bits of furniture they found lying around including a futon bed/couch which I suppose is intended to serve as additional sleeping space. Unfortunately, they didn`t find a TV or phone lying around as neither were to be found in the room. The bed was ROCK HARD and was appointed with a single, very thin, very hard pillow for each of us. There was a single top sheet and a thin bedspread and we found a questionably clean blanket in the room which gave us tolerable insulation for the night (we had to keep the AC on to remove the humidity). The bathroom had two bath towels but no additional linens such as hand towels or wash cloths. There are two small windows in the room: one has a view of a 4 foot gap between buildings and the other opens into a ventilation shaft. Really - they thought a window into the ventilation shaft would be somehow appealing. Warning: we had a couple of drinks at the Alhambra beach bar and when we went to pay they gave us an exchange of 10 pesos per US$. I tried to convince the server that this was unusually low but he wouldnt budge. At the time we were getting an exchange of between 11.5 and 12.5 pesos up on 5th Avenue. FWIW the hotel when they converted the room rate to US$ used an exchange rate of 13 pesos per US$ so they know what a dollar is worth, they just don`t care to acknowledge it at the bar. All in all we were very sad that we wasted our time at this hotel. Our advice is to find another.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Oceanfront Room”
Reviews.Author: Garishna
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I live in Minneapolis, MN, where it is very cold in the winter. We stayed at the Alhambra room D oceanfront, from Feb 8-15, 2010. I had been to Playa del Carmen several times before, but she had never been out of the U.S. or even on a plane, and she was justifyably a bit worried, so I wanted this to be a positive experience for her. I noticed all the great reviews for the Alhambra, and I am a kundalini yoga student, and I don't watch TV or use hotel phones, so the energy and philosophy of the place looked like a nice fit. i was a bit troubled to see the somewhat critical review by Greenie-300 on January 31, though. Our experience was quite different and wonderful, so I feel compelled to write about ours. I booked the hotel apartment room 4 months in advance online, had a lot of dialogue on line and in person with Daniel and Fernando, and I got what I believe to be the best room they have. They gave me a better deal than advertised by booking 7 nights, so you might consider staying there the whole time. The apartment has a separate bedroom with queen size bed, shower, hair dryer, a/c, two sofas, two desks, a kitchenette, two patio doors, large patio, table, chairs, with a fabulous ocean view, terrace overlooking Calle 8 with coconut trees next to it. Lots of floor space in the front room too. It could easily sleep 6. When we arrived, we were greeted cheerfully and warmly welcomed. Madai at the desk knew who I was when I told her, and they carried our luggage to the room. The room was very clean and orderly. Brenda, our maid, folded our towels into swans, flowers, and other beautiful sculptures, and kept the place spotless. I offered to pay for the room up front, but Madai said I could pay at the end of my stay, which I did. There were no surprises or hidden costs on the bill, and the tax was included in the price, something that many other hotels don't do. There was a problem with the a/c remote control, but they fixed that promptly, and showed us how to program the safe in the room. I left some valuable things out, and nothing was touched. They gave me keys to the room, to the patio doors, and to the main entrance door, to gain access after hours. They close the doors around 10pm, so if you go out dancing or clubbing on Calle 12, etc., you must make sure you have that entrance key. Because I'm a geek, use Facebook, Skype, and email a lot for business and pleasure, the only thing that was challenging for me was the internet WiFi service, which is only available in the lobby. I told Daniel about my concern, and he said they are going to install WiFi very soon so that it will be available in every room. In fact, they had a guy coming out to look at it the day we left. I don't care about TV or house phones. I text people back home with my cell phone, and the service works well in that area inside and outside the hotel with T-Mobile. There is a small spa, but with the ocean in front, that's all you need. theswimming is amazing. There are yoga classes every day at the Alhambra if you're into it. If you don't want o opt for an ocean front room, there are rooms on the side where you can still see the ocean, and they are much cheaper. The rooftop is open to anyone, and it has a great view. Watch out for the large log legs on the beds. Easy to stub your toes. There is noise at night from the clubs a few doors down, but it didn't bother us. There was fire dancing and drumming two doors down one night, and I walked down to watch it. Really cool. Got my photo taken with some monkeys, ate at some great restaurants, and got plenty of sun. I come to Playa for the warm weather, the ocean, the sand, the restaurants and shops on 5th Avenue, the clubs, the people watching, the Mayan ruins, the culture, and the magical energy. The beach in this area is beautiful, and the turquoise water is just a few steps away. If you have never been to Playa, you are in for a wonderful surprise. There are many places to visit in every direction. I highly recommend the Tulum ruins, and the great beach there, just south of Playa. You can take the ADO bus for about $6US per person. Be sure to bring lots of water. You can fly into either Cancun airport or Cozumel airport. From Cancun, you can take a taxi for $50US, or the ADO bus for $8. I usually take the bus to Playa. You can pay in pesos and board it just to the right as you exit terminal 3 at CUN. It's a first class Mercedes bus and very nice, unlike the city buses in the U.S. It stops at Juarez and 5th ave, which is a short walk to Alhambra at Calle 8. Going back to Cancun airport, I took a taxi this time, because it was easier. If you take the ADO bus to Cancun airport, it will stop at terminal 2, and you will have to take a shuttle to terminal 3 for international flights. Daniel arranged the airport taxi, and as per his suggestion, we got there 3 hours before departure. I'm glad we did, because there was a long wait at baggage drop. If you can, consider flying into Cozumel, taking a short taxi ride to the pier, and taking the ferry to Playa, which is just a few blocks from the hotel also.. I did that once, and I prefer it, but I have had trouble finding affordable flights to Cozumel. The ferry runs almost every hour until 9pm, and of course you can also go from Playa to Cozumel too. The restaurant in the hotel is quite nice, and the food is great. Breakfast is included with the room, so we ate there every morning on the beach. The freshly squeezed orange juice, coffee, pancakes, omlettes and bacon were great. The waiters are really nice guys. Be sure to tip the waiters, the maids, and the people at the desk. They really appreciate it and deserve it. Is the Alhambra more expensive than an all inclusive, large resort with airfare included? Yes. Yes. Quite a bit more. If you want to stay in a Holiday Inn atmosphere where you never leave the building, and have your itinerary figured out for you, perhaps you should talk to a travel agent and stay somewhere else. If however, you're like me, and you enjoy the energy of Playa, you like diversity, unpredictability, smaller hotels, the beach, the ocean, like to swim, like new experiences, enjoy shopping for unusual things, etc., you like to buy Cuban cigars, Mayan blankets, pretty dresses, jewelry, eat at many different ethnic restaurants, and you love to be near the beautiful Caribbean Ocean and white sand, then I highly recommend the Alhambra and the wonderful, cheerful people who run it. Two thumbs up, Alhambra !!!

Reviews.Title: “could be so much more”
Reviews.Author: Greenie-300
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Alhambra Hotel after a 4 day stay at the Hacienda Paradise (which we preferred). We were disappointed from the minute we walked in the door. The desk staff was completely unfriendly, not even a hello or welcome. We felt like we were interrupting something. Only the maintenance guy was friendly. The room was plain and the bed was very uncomfortable. One of the pillows had a sour dank smell and the decor was random. It would not take a lot of effort to make these rooms better. There is good space but the decor and comfort were lacking. Everything was clean, and the shower was good, but it was not worth the price and we would not go back. There was wifi in the lobby only. The location was great, right on the beach, but the way the beach chairs were squashed together in very tight rows, with no space made me feel claustrophobic. If you didn't get a seat in the front row, forget it. The chairs are also available for people who are not guests. We found there were tons of smokers in Mexico and if someone smoking sat near you, you would be breathing it in. That was not my idea of relaxing on the beach. The one high note was the breakfast. It was very fresh and quite good. The omelets and the fruit plate with yogurt and granola were fresh and well prepared. Overall, this hotel needs improvement. It should be a home run given the location, but it falls short in many ways.

Reviews.Title: “Priceless”
Reviews.Author: andwally
Reviews.Content: on Frida day I had a work meeting in Cancun and decided to expend the weekend in Playa, before returing to polluted Mexico City, walking around looking for a hotel I came accross the alhambra. After a long day working the reception couldnt be better, Daniel is a self motivated individual that will make your stay great, he is so helpful and genuinely friendly. then the Manager of the hotel a well educated person with a fantastic approach. the hotel was super clean and everyone friendly, the location couldnt be better. I have previously stayed in the Mosquito beach hotel which is just oposite to lhambra, MB is a minimalistic very welll decorated hotel bla, bla, bla... however since my stay at Alahmbra I wouldnt change it for 1000s Mosquito B hotels. David

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: lunytravelers
Reviews.Content: We love our stay at the Alhambra and can't wait to go back. We stayed a few days at another hotel that was too far from the beach so we moved over here and for less money. The location is perfect and right in the middle of everthing. There is a store a few doors down and the hotel is great the food is very good and the cocktails are strong. Taxes and breakfast included in the price of the room. We had a ocean view and love to sit and watch the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Midwestbookworm
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a group and we just loved this hotel. The location is fantastic, the beach is right outside the door and the staff are very friendly. There is little to dislike about the Alhambra if I had to say anything negative It would be that they don't have any TV's we were so busy we didn't have time to miss them though. It was sooo nice to eat breakfast (included) on the beach watching the sun rise. The food is great and the drinks are strong (what more could you ask for). Taxes were also included in the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff and gorgeous rooms. The only TRUE retreat in Playa D.C.!!!”
Reviews.Author: Havecamwilltravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got married here! We found the hotel far in advance during a trip to Playa in 2008. The Management were as elegant about their accommodating us, as the hotel interior. They helped us plan every detail with our pre-arranged wedding planner, and they provided excellent options through out our guests and ours stay. The staff was truly amazing!!! What they could not provide, they were quick to recommend alternate options for, and they hit the hammer on the nail every time. The reality of the Alhambra is breath taking beauty, gorgeous views (from most of the suites), clean rooms, and a sense that you truly have escaped your daily grind. Oh and the location is PERFECT! Nothing is too far away from one end of 5th avenue to the other on Calle 8. Internet cafe's and every other worldly amenity at your front step...and when you get back to your room...peace and quiet. What else could you ask for? The perfect view of the Caribbean Ocean? YES! They have the best rooftop on the riviera to see it from! Thanks Alhambra!

Reviews.Title: “Nice But a little too quirky for me!”
Reviews.Author: okiemex
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we got a great deal and I knew this was a great location. The rooms were nice and staff was great but I overlooked the fact that they had not only no tv so I could keep up with the market but no phone in the room. I am sorry but I even have to work some when on vacation. Luckily I rememberd that when I purchased my last phone I got a unlocked GSM phone so I got it out and it worked. The hotel ruined some of the most prime spots for a silly yoga room right up at the front along the beach. There were yoga-ites walking around in their zen like state everywhere. All that having been said it was a very nice, well kept hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect, quiet hotel, great restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: easygoing_traveler09
Reviews.Content: A perfect small hotel, very quiet, very clean. Very nice clean rooms,not too fancy, but very nice. We were surprised by how great the restraurant was. We went to a number of places on the main avenue, but this is a gem! And I dont think a lot of people know about this restraurant, since it's in the quiet beach area. The food was delicious, healthy, Aztec chicken kebabs on a hot stone were awesome! and all those sauces to choose from! Very nice. Great prices too! Loved this hotel, made our trip very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing intimate place to spend a week in paradise”
Reviews.Author: apetcorn
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay. We had a great experience. The rooms were bright and clean. The locations was perfect. It was a bit noisy at night but we were on vacation with no responsibilities. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our morning breakfasts on the beach were tasty and fresh. The views were amazing from our balcony. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: catz9886
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday from 8 glorious days in Quintana Roo, 4 of them at the Alhambra. My husband and I loved this place and found it to be fabulous in every way with the minor exception of a hard mattress on the bed that bothered my husbands' back ( he has some minor issues with it) but not mine. Other than that, it was perfect. Everyone involved with the Alhambra was more than gracious, the service prompt, the breakfast and lucnch on the beach very good and the massages excellent. The environment of the hotel is so peaceful. We did not want to leave and look more than forward to our next visit to Playa and only the Alhambra! By the way, there is NO swine flu to be found here! Thanks Alhambra for everything!

Reviews.Title: “a special place”
Reviews.Author: KansasPVgal
Reviews.Content: This review is late as we actually stayed at Hotel Alhambra in November 2007. This was our first trip to Playa del Carmen and we wanted some place in town. Hotel Alhambra was perfect for our needs. It's charm quotient is high! It is located barely a block off of 5th avenue and is on the beach. This is not a fancy place, but it's so charming, sweet, and has a definite Mexican feel. No watering down of the local culture factor here. We had never stayed anywhere like this in a resort town before and am so glad we chose the Alhambra and to stay in town. We stayed in the large room on the beach side on the top floor. You can see by my pictures that it's very clean and summery fresh. They also provide plenty of bottled water in your room which is free. The view from this room is fabulous and will keep you happily occupied while drinking your morning coffee. On the con side, it was somewhat loud after midnight due to bar music down the beach. I use earplugs so it didn't bother me much, but my husband didn't have any. Also there is not much space for your clothing, but it would not keep me from coming back. Bed is hard, as most are in Mexico. There is no pool and we don't require one. There is the gorgeous sandy gulf footsteps from your room. The rest of Hotel Alhambra is very homey as if you have a little apartment there. There isn't an uncharming corner in the place! They have a very large rooftop sunning area which would also be great for family or group gatherings. We only ate breakfast which was part of our room price and it was very good and of normal size. You can eat inside or on the sand outside. There is coffee downstairs in the morning and you can bring a cup to your room. The location was absolutely perfect for walking up and down 5th Avenue. You should know that when you get to Playa del Carmen you will have to pull your own bags down to the hotel because 5th Ave. is a pedestrian only zone. The cabs let you off as close as possible and it's really only a short two block walk, but you will see other people doing this too for any accomodations east of 5th avenue. Do bring rolling suitcases for this purpose. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. You will not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: fartypantz
Reviews.Content: We were in Playa for our beach wedding, and booked 6 rooms, including the Ocean Front room for ourselves. We chose the Alhambra for it's proximity to the beach and "main drag", and also due to the fact it was situated at the quieter end of Playa. We were not disappointed. The rooms were clean and light and airy. The Ocean Front room was absolutely fantastic, with mini fridge, unlimited purified water and balcony overlooking the beach - a great place where our wedding guests congregated each evening for drinks before dinner. The staff were friendly and helpful, and all the arrangements which they made to collect our various guests from the airport went smoothly. The food at the restaurant was delicious, and Happy Hour was well appreciated each afternoon. There was a bit of noise from the nightclub further up the beach every night, but that could not be helped - and ear plugs solved that little problem anyway. If you are looking for a large, soulless, all-inclusive resort, this is not the place for you. But if you are looking for an intimate hotel which is full of character, then you can't go past the Alhambra. I cannot thank them enough for making our special time here even more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: shelingas_sis
Reviews.Content: The staff at Alhambra was extremely helpful and responsive. Any e-mail I sent to the hotel was immediately returned. They arranged for transportation to meet us at the airport. Our room was spotless and had a nice balcony view of the beach. There is a nice roof-top solarium that is perfect when you want to get away from the crowds on the beach. Alhambra had a nice section of the beach with lawn chairs and an attentive bar staff. We took advantage of the couples massage ($80 total for two people) and it was excellent. As another reviewer wrote, the beds are rock hard, which is my only real complaint. It was a bit noisy too, but we slept with the windows open and the AC off, so it is to be expected when you are so close to the main drag. All in all, I would recommend this hotel to friends, but would suggest using the mattress from the futon to make things more comfortable. It is a good value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “My second stay was as glorious as the first!”
Reviews.Author: mahandeva
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our second stay at the Alhambra. It was as wonderful as last year, if not better. The service is excellent. The rooms are immaculate. The food is well prepared and clean. There is a sort of camaraderie among the hotel visitors, many of whom have been vacationing at the Alhambra for years. Very cool! I was so touched by how the hotel staff remembered us from last year and warmly and sincerely thanked us for staying with them again this year! This is a simple, peaceful hotel. We are already looking forward to next year.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great experience”
Reviews.Author: carynsBoston_Ma
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights and were very happy with the hotel. The hotel was in the perfect location, right on the beach but also near all the action. The best parts of the hotel were the location, a clean room, a refridgerator and purified water in the room and a restaurant on the beach. The staff was friendly. We loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK, not great”
Reviews.Author: sspc
Reviews.Content: Pros: I just spent two nights at Alhambra. Room #4. The room is small and very clean. No real amenities but not really missed on a short stay. The staff is friendly and very helpful. Wait staff is also good. The breakfast is decent to be included. The best meal I had was the grilled red snapper with veggies, the worse meal was the nachos (avoid them at all cost) the location is good and the beach is nice. Rates are reasonable. Cons: This hotel is very noisy. From the construction sounds to the cars and garbage truck that comes at 3am it’s impossible to get any real rest, afternoon or night. The yoga/meditation class is in Spanish, so unless you speak it will be hard to follow. The wireless internet only works in the lobby, even though they might tell you otherwise. There is only one outlet in the room and it’s an old one, so you cannot recharge your computer without an adaptor. The beds are very firm, very basic. They ask you to pay upfront for your entire stay. So, you’re stuck if you want to change hotels for some reason. Doors close at 10pm, so make sure you get there before then otherwise getting into the hotel can be tricky.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, rare find in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: teko11
Reviews.Content: I have vacationed in Playa about 10 times. I've stayed at a variety of places from the 2 star cheapos to the 5 star Royal and Alhambra is now my new favorite. The staff were very friendly, attentive, informative and polite. The rooms are simple and peaceful. The restaurant is great. Loved the included breakfasts on the beach. Alhambra sits on the best part of the main beach. Even though it sits right in the middle of everything, the hotel itself was quiet at night and deliriously relaxing during the day. I also loved the in house Yoga classes in their ocean front studio. The popular 12th street bars and clubs are only a few steps away but just far enough that the noise doesn't keep you up till dawn if you prefer to get some sleep. It is also less than a block from the best cafe, Cafe Sastre on 5th between 8th and 10th.

Reviews.Title: “great!”
Reviews.Author: butterfly028
Reviews.Content: - very friendly staff - excellent price/performance ratio - nice and clean rooms - delicious food - located directly at the beach and also in the heart of Playa

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil Treasure!”
Reviews.Author: ccmbh143
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my first vacation ever with my boyfriend of 8 years, needless to say, it had to be perfect. The Alhambra and its outstanding staff facilitated in making our first time away together just as i had hoped. The building/room - the hotel, while being in the heart of Playa, can be easily overlooked due to it's discrete nature. This hotel prides itself on providing a peaceful and tranquil environment. The whole place, details included are all white, pristine and calming. our room had a wrap around balcony looking out onto the ocean and out to Cozumel. while there was ac, the abundance of windows let in a constant breeze keeping us quite comfortable and able to fall to sleep to the sound of the ocean. Every morning we went to the hotel's restaurant, Zabor, which provides a complementary breakfast, the chilaquiles, while not in the traditional style, are outstanding, (try them with a sunny side up egg on top - my new favorite dish). after breakfast on the beach, we would take a dip in the warm ocean and head back to our room which was cleaned daily by a wonderful group of women, who were totally trustworthy and thorough. we loved coming back to see the sculpture they had created out of our fresh towels. There is also an abundance of purified water throughout the hotel, either in one's room or just down the hall. If we hadn't been so relaxed, we would have woken up for the early morning yoga classes available. Other yoga classes are available too which are frequented by both Playa residents and hotel clients as well. The Staff - along with the wonderful restaurant, the hotel also has a spa. they offer a wide variety of massages, both for couples or individuals, as well as facials and other treatments, the orchid facial was terrific. The spa manager takes every step to provide the highest quality services and to ensure total comfort and relaxation. The owners, managers, and all other staff treat each client with the utmost respect, warmth and attentiveness. When my boyfriend's laptop failed to boot, one of the staff lent us his computer in order to handle a business emergency. I was truly blown away by just how kind and happy everyone was and i thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Alhambra. It was great to see so many return clients and i will surely be one of them hopefully sooner than another 8 years. If you get a chance try the hot rocks dinner at Zabor, i recommend it as a nice alternative from the norm, imagine the last bite of food being as warm as the first. The restaurant is also vegetarian friendly, there is a plethora of options for both omnivores and vegetarians.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not Great”
Reviews.Author: chrisSyracuse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Alhambra for a 7 nights in July. It was satisfactory, nothing to "wow" over. Breakfast was included every morning, and the food was ok....nothing great. The staff were always friendly, however not extremely knowledgeable. Rooms were clean, however A/C didn't always work. The jacuzzi was never turned on, it was more or less an extremely small swimming pool in the lobby. As well, the solarium was in need of a fresh coat of paint. For $100/night, it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “little piece of heaven”
Reviews.Author: giramondo77
Reviews.Content: This is indeed a little piece of heaven on earth. The intimate an clean Alhambra is a real bijoux. Situated on the best strech of beach in the heart of Playa del Carmen. The staff, especially at the reception and the restaurant, is very helpful an polite an not saving at all a nice smile to their clients. I can highly recommend this place where you just can relax and recharge.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, affordable beachfront hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RichardChicago
Reviews.Content: Though I've been to Playa before, this was my first time staying at the Alhambra. There were things I liked and disliked about the hotel, so here's a breakdown. Pros - 1. Location - right off a very vibrant part of 5th Ave, on 8th St. Easy walk to ferry and bus terminal, as well as everything on 5th Ave.....can't get better than that. 2. Price - the low season rate, for a beachfront hotel, is quite reasonable. 3. Clean - enough said. Pretty spotless hotel, and the room & linens were immaculate. 4. Breakfast - included in the price is a variety of made to order breakfast entrees that you can eat on the beach. A real plus! 5. Staff - whoever I dealt with was quite friendly. Cons - 1. Beach - this section of beach cannot be compared to where I have been before, down at Mamita's on 28th street. It's not very wide, there's rocks at the entrance to the water, as well as seaweed and a lot of debris churning. Quite disappointed in the quality of the beach, which was the main reason for booking. 2. Room amenities - no in-room safe, no TV, no small fridge. No one goes on vacation to watch TV, but it's nice to check the news, or have something to do when the weather is bad, and you don't want to be outside in a rainstorm. 3. Noise - we could hear noise each night, especially from the musician at the Italian restaurant right next door. 4. Hotel policies - a bit annoying to be honest. Full payment was expected at check in, and you need to put $20 deposit for each beach towel. They only give you 1 key, and any more is $20 deposit each. Since the doors of the hotel are shut at 10pm sharp, this is an inconvenience when you have a single key to the hotel and room. 5. Water pressure - in a word, very poor in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “The Alhambra is wonderful in so many ways!!”
Reviews.Author: Nerak936
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the second time at the Alhambra in Playa del Carmen from May 8-17, 2008. I had shared their BEST room with a friend last August (2007) and just HAD to return to share it with my fiance for 9 days!! I can't say enough about this place. While we certainly did stay in their BEST room (#14 - 3rd floor, ocean front), I seriously doubt there is a "bad" room in the place. The location (right ON the beach in Playa) cannot be beat, the staff is competent, efficient, and VERY friendly, the cleanliness of the accommodations is top-notch, and the food and drinks were delicious and fairly priced, given the location and ambiance (who can beat eating breakfast, lunch, or dinner with your toes in the sand looking out at that gorgeous Caribbean??!!) I wouldn't (and haven't) hesitate to recommend the Alhambra to one and all. For a quiet, clean, efficiently-run hotel that is right on the beach but close to the action of downtown Playa, it just doesn't get any better. We just LOVE the place!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Physio97
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a week vacation in Playa Del Carmen. Choosing a hotel was confusing. Checking ratings on different hotels in Playa only showed that you can't please everybody all the time. Reviews were mixed on every hotel. We chose the Alhambra due to the location directly on the beach and the reasonable rates. It quickly became evident that we made a great choice. The hotel itself is no frills but it is clean and comfortable. The location on the beach and just steps away from 5th Avenue was very convenient. Noise was never a problem and the free breakfast was a nice perk. The staff, from the cleaning ladies to the front desk, was friendly and very helpful. We were tempted to go the all inclusive route but there are so many wonderful places to eat,shop and play in Playa we couldn't see paying the extra money. It was a good decision. The staff knew us by name after a couple of days and went out of their way to make sure we got what we wanted. Angel and Brito (sp?) were awsome. If pressed to describe any negatives I would say the AC left much to be desired and there was no TV. Other than that the Alhambra was perfect. We will go again.

Reviews.Title: “The Employees Will Bring You Back”
Reviews.Author: MrCleanandCurly
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at a nearby hotel 2 years ago but came to love the Alhambra because of the good drinks and great beach service. We decided if we ever came back to Playa we would stay there. Our room was bright, clean, and quiet and all of the employees were extremely friendly and helpful. Gonzales even remembered us from our previous trip! We had a great breakfast on the beach (included) every morning and the drinks, snacks, and lunches were as good or better than we remembered. The Alhambra is very small and 'authentic' feeling with lots of beautiful tile and gorgeous wooden doors. A small spiral staircase to the roof-top solarium makes you feel like you're discovering a hidden secret garden. The Alhambra, on the prettiest part of the beach in Playa, is in a great location one block off 5th Avenue which is close enough to walk to everything but far enough away from the night life to ensure a good night's sleep. We had such a wonderfully relaxing vacation experience at the Alhambra that we are planning to go back with a group of friends next year. If you're looking for five swimming pools and a high-rise building this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A heavenly experience!”
Reviews.Author: palmboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Alhambra for ten days on our first visit to Playa del Carmen. I chose the hotel because primarily because of its beach location but also due to the fact that they host yoga classes in a oceanfront studio and and have an onsite restaurant which features vegetarian selections. I don't partake in either of these, but I see them as an indicator of caring and civility! I work in the hotel business and within five minutes of checking in (Hola, Britta!), realized that we were in a place where the staff took great pride in their establishment. The facility is a spotless white moorish - style mini palace with beautiful wooden accents, our room (5), small but with a great balcony. We would lay in our extremely comfy king size bed and see palm trees and the ocean. I don't need much more to be happy. Breakfast is served under palapas and palms at the oceans edge by an efficient and friendly staff - ( please be a decent human being and tip - just because breakfast is complimentary doesn't mean the waiters are doing less work!) There are beach chairs for guests, but because of hurricane activity in past years, it appears from old pics that the beach has shrunken a little, a factor out of the hotel's control. This was not a problem, however, as there are beach clubs, (one very stylish one next door) where you can rent lounges and umbrellas for about 5 dollars each and have ice cold coronas and shrimp ceviche delivered to your sunburned self! This is not a hotel for the party crowd, and we were thankful for it. We had some of the most restful nights ever on vacation, largely because of its location. When you need entertainment, you are just a block away! Ihave some great pics and will try to post them in the near future! Senor Cinco

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to be near town and on the beach”
Reviews.Author: caseyrebecca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Alhambra for the first three nights of our vacation in Quintana Roo. The Hotel Alhambra is right in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Playa del Carmen and on the beach. It is not really the place to stay for total beach relaxation (no pool, crowded beach), but is a great HQ while exploring nearby. Good breakfast and great location for exploring town and nearby attractions. Note: If you are getting around by car it is tough to find parking, and we ended up paying for a nearby lot a few times.

Reviews.Title: “Low key”
Reviews.Author: goin_there_doin_that
Reviews.Content: The Alhambra is just a short distance down the hill from 5th. Overall it was ok but generally unremarkable for the price. The desk staff, Fernando and Angel, were helpful but seemed a bit over worked. This hotel was one of the cleanest I have ever been in and it is nice to be on the beach, It's close to the Blue Parrot bar which is a great watering hole. And we found a nice dive shop which took us on a tour to the cenote "dos ojos" (two eyes) -do this!!!. I was there for 3 nights and found it a little too quiet at the hotel its self . At night the front door is locked at 10pm and there is no one at the front desk. The street out side is deserted at night. It was concerning that there was no dead bolt or chain on the door, just the keyed passage set. There is no safe or TV in the tiny rooms. I would like to rate it better but because my experiance wasn't bad however I feel it could have been better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: tvcraig
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Christmas in Playa del Carmen and I just loved where we stayed. We not only ate breakfast on the beach, included in the price, but we were one block from the main drag. Talk about the center of it all!!! If you are looking for a great bed or great shower this is not for you. We only paid $140 a night and the beauty of the hotel and the ideal location more than made up for the lack of comforts. The room was large, the service was great, and we had a balcony that looked out to the sea. Beautiful place, great location, less than perfect ammenities. Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise for a family wedding party!!!”
Reviews.Author: solsmami2000
Reviews.Content: It's been a couple of weeks, and the great memories still linger on! Our 7 year old still raves about the great time he had playing on the beach with his cousins. We had an ocean-view room with a balcony facing the ocean and slept with the sound of waves every night. Fresh linens and towels plus we could check out beach towels as well. Our own 5 gallon container of purified water with a fridge was a nice extra plus there was a purified water dispenser in the hallway as well. THANK YOU! For those of us with kids, that fridge was a lifesaver and worth the extra $. We shopped at a local market and bought beer, yogurt, fruit, milk and cereal for those times we weren't up to going out to dine. We could replenish our water bottles and stash them in the fridge. Cost saving measures for sure but really, it's more about the saving of time and not having to go out each and every time you need something. From the waiter, to front desk personnel to housekeeping, quick efficiency made that hotel hum. Never were we told no, every request was attended to. We were in town for a family wedding, and had the front desk arrange for a wonderful day trip to Tulum and Xel-Ha. Payment arrangements, pick up in front of the hotel ... with lots of children in tow, a much appreciated amenity. Beach front location was primo. We ate breakfast (included) and then lounged on the chairs after the staff set up the beach umbrellas. Five star service at reasonable prices. A low key, clean hotel without an attitude yet close enough to high end restaurants/hotels AND funky out of the way, local restaurants. LOVED THE CENTRAL LOCATION. The wedding party, from Mexico and California, will certainly return for a family reunion in the very near future. We've stayed in some of the finer hotels in the US (Loews, for one), and I must say, for the money and the overall goodwill of the staff, this is truly a gem of a hotel. PS Don't forget to tip the staff as it is SO MUCH appreciated! We tried to do it every day for the waiters, and at the end of our stay for the maids. Good karma, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful people and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah009
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Alhambra after reading about the hotel in Lonely Planet. We turned up without a booking and were shown a choice of rooms by the friendly and helpful receptionist, and chose one on the second floor overlooking the beach. The room was great value for the money - clean and spacious with a sweet balcony looking out over the stunning view. The room price also includes breakfast - not just toast and coffee, but a full breakfast which is served in the beach front restaurant. A lovely start to the day. The hotel is perfectly situated - right by the main restaurant strip, but on the beach so you're not kept up all night by street noise. During our three day stay in Playa we were made aware of a problem which could have turned our holiday into a disaster. If not for the help and understanding of the absolultey wonderful and amazing staff, our trip to Mexico could have ended very differently. I have never encountered more friendly people and forever will remember how kind they were. As well as that, my partner fell while in Playa and he was looked after by the staff as if he were family - with bandages, help with doctors, the works. Never in my life have I been to a hotel where I truly felt so looked after, whatever the problem. I simply cannot recommend this hotel enough for value for money and the wonderful people who run it and if as we hope, we get back to the Riviera one day, we'll stay there without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Cynnkitty
Reviews.Content: We came to the Alhambra with no reservation after being dissapointed by a pretty but mundane all inclusive in Playacar and we were lucky enough to get a lovely room on the second floor. It is absolutely lovely! Bright, inviting, immaculate and the location right on the beach is superb. Comfortable rooms and an excellent value as well. Beautiful roof sundeck ( underused, so it's very private!) and a pretty courtyard. The little pool/jacuzzi area looked as if it was not in use while we were there ...a shame 'cause it looks so nice! No TV in our room, but we don't really watch it so it was not missed. Good food at the restaurant, and beach service was decent even though they were very busy. They were very friendly and accomodating. Overall we really enjoyed the Alhambra... we hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel to be re-visited”
Reviews.Author: UkAMcL
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Playa del Carment where we spent 12 nights in the Alhambra. Situated right on the beach it offers all the pleasures of essentially living on the beach or not. Both inside and out, the hotel is maintained to a very high standard. The staff are attentive without being intrusive, the food is well presented and varied, the rooms are welcoming and user friendly, there is Yoga and countless other pampering opportunities on offer, and, perhaps most importantly, there is the certainty that the whole enterprise is being managed to maximise customer satisfaction. We truly enjoyed this Hotel and have very intention of returning. Ian and Alice McLure, Sheffield, UK.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Laurelena
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Alhambra. Great rooms, service, and the breakfast is amazing. I would definitely stay there again, and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Alhambra Hotel- Great Stay on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: carinosa2
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Alhambra Hotel was a pleasant one. Our room was cleaned daily, and it is evident that the owners take pride in maintaining their facility. The location is bar none as it is a beachfront property. The balcony was huge and nice to sit out on and enjoy the ocean breeze. Take note that the rooms are simple, no frills here. There was no t.v., clock or phone in the room but who needs that anyway when the beach is at your front door? Entrance in to the beach is too rocky, so just enter in about 30-40 feet over to the left and enjoy paradise!

Reviews.Title: “What noise!!!”
Reviews.Author: italianluvr0126
Reviews.Content: Denise Jade and friend Los Angeles, CA June 10-15 We just got back from a 5 night stay at the hotel Alhambra stayed in their apartment room overlooking the beautiful blue sea. There was some construction 2 buildings down but it was hardly noticable. This hotel is in the best location right on the sand but also half a block from the charming town. The hotel is all white and so well maintaned.The staff is so nice, everyone had a smile on their face and they went out of their way to please you, also the food at their resturant is excellent! I would highly recommend this hotel and cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of construction noise!!!”
Reviews.Author: Manuel & Diana Alderete
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alhambra May 13-17. Read all previous reviews and saw nothing about construction noise. I guess it might have just started after the last review in April. Anyway 2 doors away the old El Faro Hotel has been demolished and new condos are being built. The construction starts at 8:30am and ends at approx. 5:30-6:00pm every day except Sunday. It can be heard on the beach as well as in the rooms. This of course is not the fault of the Alhambra. The hotel itself is a nice, clean basic hotel in a great location with a beautiful beach. Just felt obligated to let the readers know who may be staying in the immediate future.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Alhambra”
Reviews.Author: jessrkim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alhambra in April 2007 and really enjoyed our stay. We had an ocean-view room (the balcony is on the street side, but has a view of the ocean) that was on the 2nd floor. The room was kept spotless and the entire hotel was clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful and always friendly. The food was always tasty. The beach front location was really the best part. I loved being able to walk out to the beach from the steps of the hotel There was always a lounge chair and a clean towel for us. It was such a great way to spend the day. The only complaint was the HARD bed. I know beds in Mexico are hard, I have stayed at many hotels in Mexico and slept in firm beds that were just fine. This wasn't firm, it was HARD. However, we had a futon in our room and just threw the futon pad on the bed and we were just fine. :-) We loved Alhmbra and loved Playa del Carmen. We would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: jketl
Reviews.Content: The Alhambra Hotel was perfect for our first trip to Playa del Carmen. It's small, very reasonable, very clean, right on the beach and in the middle of all of the good restaurants and shopping in town. The hotel staff were all very nice and accomodating. The hotel restaurant, where you can have the included breakfast at tables right on the beach, was decent with really good frozen drinks perfect for ordering from your comfortable beach chair. And the waiters are always willing to set up a beach umbrella for you when you've had enough sun. Keep in mind that the hotel rooms do not have tv or phone, and the hotel does not have a pool, but with the gorgeous beach right there, who needed them? And since the coffee at the hotel was not very good, be sure to check out Cafe Sasta on Avenida 5 between Calle 8 and 10 (just before the Starbucks - don't dream of going there instead). The lattes at Cafe Sasta are fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Alhambra Hotel was perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: babieboo
Reviews.Content: Myself and 2 girl friends stayed at the Alhambra for the first 2 weeks in March. It couldn't have been better! Reasonably priced, wonderfully clean and spacious rooms, and the hotel is right on the beach front and close to 5th Avenue but away from any noise. Sun loungers and clean beach towels are provided every day - free for guests. The breakfast was included in the price - great choices and great food! The staff were wonderful - Angel and Fernando on the front desk were very helpful and speak good English, and the waiters were great - Roberto, Silviero, Gabriel etc. And our room was kept spotless by Maria and Ricardo! And HI to the wonderful couple we met from California who were also staying at the Alhambra - Lynne and Rich! XXX Hope to see you again at the Alhambra. Would definitely go back to Playa, which was a wonderful place, and would DEFINITELY stay at the Alhambra

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: wildwoodgal
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our 4th stay at the Alhambra, and it just keeps getting better! We had an oceanfront room (#4) the first year, but the past 3 years we have had oceanview, which also has a (smaller) balcony. The rooms are very clean, with bottled water always available. We love the fact that there is no TV, no phone, and no internet access...we go on vacation to get away from all that! It is the perfect place to unwind and relax, walk on the beach, read a book, and have excellent service from the friendly staff. We especially appreciate the lounge chairs and fresh beach towels every day. And we always seem to meet new friends on the beach --- this year we especially enjoyed the company of 3 great girls from England. Fernando, Emmanuel, and Angel at the front desk are always very helpful. The waiters -- Roberto, Gonzalo, Gabriel, Antonio -- are the best, and we love that they remember us each year. The best thing about this trip was the new restaurant, Zabor. Breakfast and lunch have always been great, but this is the first time dinner has been offered. Our meal was excellent --- easily the best dinner we had in Playa --- and you can't beat the setting on the beach at night with the waves and the breeze. We're already looking forward to next year!

Reviews.Title: “The Amazing Alhambra”
Reviews.Author: irishrover22
Reviews.Content: After looking extensively for a beach front hotel in Playa Del Carmen that wouldn't cost a small fortune, my wife and I truly lucked out when we found Hotel Alhambra. The staff is SO nice and accomodating. The hotel is very QUIET. The FULL breakfast, which is included, is delicious, and the rooms are spacious, clean, and romantic. The showers are HOT, and there is bottled water, and bottled water dispensers on every floor, and sometimes even in the room! and the beach front dining and chair/towel service is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and Service with a smile!!”
Reviews.Author: LaurelMontana
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Alhambra Feb 12-17 and totally enjoyed our stay. Certainly it wasn't as fancy as the resorts we have stayed at, but if you are looking for a clean beach front hotel, this is it!! I can't say enough about the staff, friendly and courteous, and always willing to help out. Our housekeeper was Maria, who kept our room spotless everyday. We really enjoyed visiting with Emmanuel at the front desk, who was always willing to help us out with things to do, places to eat etc. Oh, and don't forget the breakfast on the beach that is included in the price, wow!! We had the Chilequiles every morning we were there. Alhambra, thank you for sharing your country with us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Peeps”
Reviews.Author: McBad
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Alhambra is very friendly and helpful. We had some issues with the hard beds and they provided us with a mattress cushion right away. The hotel is quaint, nice, located right on the beach. Has a great rooftop deck, is clean, well kept, and has a super cool place to eat (also on the beach). Water pressure was adequate. other than the hard beds (which I hear is standard in mexico), no complaints...and a very reasonable price which included free breakfast!! all in all a great visit.

Reviews.Title: “Sexy, romantic, clean”
Reviews.Author: ArdentTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 4, Oceanfront with a balcony as large as the room overlooking the awesome beach and unbelievably blue Caribbean for only $160 per night. The hotel is even more beautiful and sophisticated than their website represents (which is not the case for most small beachfront hotels in Playa). We travel the world and its the first time I've ever gotten to know the helpful people at the front desk by name, Fernando and Angel couldn't have been nicer. There was no phone (or TV) in the room, which was delightful, however the front desk is more than happy to make reservations, etc. for you. We were there for a friends wedding at an all-inclusive resort down the beach. When they visited our room they were wowed!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, great balcony, relaxing atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: VillaGlen
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some great balconies facing the street leading down to the beach. Looking up to the left you see the main drag and to the right (and closer) is the ocean and the beach. Just what you want to hang out on when you come back home. The Alhambra is a relaxing place and offers yoga and other meditation on-site (but we didn't have time to take them). It really seems like a bit of an oasis. We found this place at the last minute when we decided to extend our stay in PDC. What a find. Very reasonable price because they skip the TV, phone and other stuff we don't need in your room and the rooms are a decent size without trying to impress you with extra space. Plus they keep it clean and the staff was excellent. The front of the hotel is on the beach but in the end I preferred the side rooms. We'll be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: jimhp900
Reviews.Content: Wow...you will be surprised...Excellent beach and view. They have four units that face the ocean. Numbers 4 and 14 face the ocean. These are one bedrooms. Unit D is an apartment and has 2 beds, micro, ref, and a sofa bed that u could use and it faces the ocean, all three have balconies...They give you breakfast everyday. Use the other hotel called Playa next door for lunch and dinner....they have better food. Do not under any condition do the free thing from the vendors on the street....they added a new twist to time share called membership. Why anyone would give them 37k for a membership is stupid. Go to Blue Parrot for nitelife. it is down the street at 12th Norte. Cool place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Sophouli
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our vacation a couple of days ago. We really enjoyed staying at this hotel. The staff were very nice and friendly. The hotel rooms were clean and spacious. The breakfast choices were plentiful and we can't stress enough about the location. Alahambra is located on the beach and steps away from 5th Avenue but not too close to the noise. If we were to go back to PDC we would stay here again. The price included breakfast, taxes air conditioning and a fan. They also have a roof top deck where you can watch the sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, hotel...”
Reviews.Author: elvisisdead
Reviews.Content: Great hotel... The location on the main beach in Playa del Carmen cannot be beat. The hotel is one of the originals on the beach, and while it is older, it is well maintained and spotless. If you're looking for a basic, clean hotel in the best location in Playa, this will be one of your best bets (Playa Maya, which is next store, is also great).

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. It is clean, bug free and run by friendly and kind people. We liked in particular - The location. It is on a lovely beach, close to all the nicest restaurants and night clubs. - The breakfast. Getting freshly cooked eggs to order while sitting on the beach was wonderful. - Maid Service. They did a great job in cleaning our room and the towel art was super.

Reviews.Title: “Keeps getting better!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent the last two weeks of May at the Alhambra. We had a wonderful time. Since our last visit the hotel has a new indoor restaurant and bar. It still needs a little work, but once done, guests will have a beautiful space in which to dine. As usual, the staff is excellent and the managerial staff runs a tight ship. We enjoyed the food at the restaurant so much that we had lunch there just about everyday. The Alhambra is a very nice, clean, and simple hotel. We got the rest and relaxation that we needed. Thank you very much Michel, Marie, Roberto, Fernando, Gonzalo, Gabriel, Rosa, Irene, Miguel, Isidro, Victor, Pepe, Eusebio for making sure that our stay was a very pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: 482Cat
Reviews.Content: Great location on the beach, clean, good food, and the people were warm, friendly, and helpful. Will stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel, great price on beach”
Reviews.Author: SKLPortland
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Alhambra Hotel - end of April- and were very pleased with the hotel cleanliness, location and service. We did use trip advisor comments to choose this hotel and were pleased with our choice. We were looking for a nice hotel for a good price - right on the beach. We were not expecting a 4 or 5 star resort - this is not one. This is a nice boutique hotel on the beach. Our room was on the 3rd floor, overlooking the beach, directly next door to the yoga room (our's was the nicest room they have - according to Eduardo). It is pictured in their brochure - and acurately. The room was very clean, large, came with a refrigerator and a 5 gallon water dispenser. The air could have been a little cooler - but was adequate. We did experience a little trouble with hot water the first day - but for the most part it worked well - sometimes you had to let it run a while. The balcony was nice for people watching -but was quite windy at times. The pool (or they call it jacuzzi - but not hot) was mostly for looks - but good for refreshing. The rinse shower is located near the lobby - an inconvenience when you want to rinse after swimming in the ocean. The staff was very nice, from Eduardo at the front desk to Roberto (we loved him) at the restaurant/bar/beach service - both spoke excellent english and were very helpful and friendly. Location - excellent - 5th Avenue just one block away - everything within easy walking distance. Beach - the beach was nice - and even bigger by the time we left - gained about 20 feet. Chairs were always put out for use, umbrellas available upon request. If you tip the waiters from the hotel next door (Playa Maya)- you might be able to get a cushion to use - one thing the Alhambra was lacking. Three drawbacks - 1) on Sundays and holidays - this section of the beach becomes quite busy - good day for sightseeing. 2) A popular dive shop moors their boats just in front - although they are gone all day - it is entertaining watching people trying to get in! 3) They don't really clean the beach - like the resorts do - we watched a big huge piece of burlap wash up on the beach - none of our hotel staff - or surrounding hotel staff picked it up - they just let the sand eventually bury it - very strange. All in all - it was a nice beach . Dining - Breakfast in included with your roon - nothing to write home about - but convenient. Not sure if the coffee was instant or what?? It varied daily. We - being from the NW - do like our coffee - so mid-stay discovered a coffee house 2 blocks away (on 5th) - great lattes. Did not eat lunch at Alhambra - as breakfast was marginal - we did eat lunch next door at Playa Maya - great guacamole, decent food. Area Dining -The hotel is just one block off 5th Ave - and all kinds of restaurants. However, we prefered the local cuisine better than the 'fine' dining restaurants. I just think that Playa's definition of fine international dining and mine is different. We ate a lot of meals at Los Almendros on 10th Ave and Calle 6 - Excellent Mayan food! Very inexpensive - and only a few blocks away. Margaritas were good. Not fancy at all, plastic tables, chairs - but really delicious - wish I could remember the name of the Mayan pork - only served at night. The dinner menu is all in spanish. A nice upscale restaurant for dinner was Yaxche Maya - just up from the hotel on 8th - very good Mayan food - more intimate, beautiful garden dining, excellent service. Both of these restaurants were recommended at [-------------] Transportation - this trip to Playa - we decided to use the Riviera Bus from and to the airport in Cancun. We were a little skeptical - but it was great. They travel every hour, they are air conditioned, comfy seats, bathroom, TV's (that play the same show over and over). The bus terminal is about 4 blocks from the hotel - we walked - make sure you have a rolling bag - or your bags are light. The cost - $8 per person each way - and the bus is direct - no stops. I understand, from friends we made - that you can take the same type bus to Cancun (or Isles Mujeres w/ferry) for about $4 each way from Playa. It's a great deal - and comfortable/efficient. All in all - we thought our stay at the Alhambra Hotel was very nice and would recommend it. See pics.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: wiki
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very basic but clean and comfortable. We stayed both in a superior room and a standard room and found, oddly, that the cheaper standard room was much bigger and much quieter than the superior room which had a view of the ocean from the balcony. Not the quietest hotel in the world. Not the greatest service-- there was a snafu when we checked in and they weren't particularly warm or accomodating about it, but overall, for the price, it's fine. The new hotel next door (The Mosquito, I think it was called) is way nicer and we were a bit jealous of their accomodations but it's also twice the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MDigre
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Alhambra for 2 nights on a weekend trip to Playa del Carmen. Normally we stay at a friend's condo but it was booked. This was our first experience at an "in-town" hotel in PDC. Even though "in-town" the Alhambra is still on the beach and just steps away from 5th. Everything was very clean. The room was small but had a balcony with a sea view. The outdoor restaurant/bar/beach lounge area was a great place to spend the day starting with the included breakfast. Nice massage facilities. Ask for Charly who is a great masseur. Wonderful service from the restaurant/bar staff who made us feel very much at home. We go to PDC usually twice a year and I would definitely go back to Alhambra.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, Good location, Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Sunlover42
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night the last day of February, 2006. It was nice but overpriced ($120/night) for what we got. The rooms are tiny with two double beds squeezed in a small room and a bathroom that reminded me of a cruise ship size bathroom. The door opens out because there is no space for it to open in. One step in and the shower, sink and toilet are all at your fingertips! The location right on the beach at Playa del Carmen was the best thing about the hotel. There is a rooftop deck area that offers nice views of the beach and the free breakfast on the beach was nice. The rooms were clean, service was good during the hours that it was staffed. If we had paid $80 or less I would hve been happy with this hotel but $120 was too much.
